text: Haydée Mercedes Sosa (9 July 1935Mercedes Sosa at BrainyHistory.com - 4 October 2009) was an Argentine singer. She was popular throughout Latin America and many countries outside the continent. Sosa became one of the important examples of nueva canción. She gave voice to songs written by both Brazilians and Cubans. She was best known as the "voice of the voiceless ones".Singer Mercedes Sosa: The voice of the 'voiceless ones' outlasts South American dictatorships Sosa suffered from breathing problems in later years. Sosa went into hospital in Buenos Aires on September 18, 2009. She died from multiple organ failure on October 4, 2009. She was aged 74. ==References== ==Other websites== * Tribute to Mercedes Sosa (in Portuguese BR) * Mercedes Sosa's website (in Spanish) * Mercedes Sosa's News (in Spanish) * Category:1935 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:Argentine singers Category:Latin Grammy Award winners Category:People from Tucumán Province
title: Mercedes Sosa
